message.content:
cs.CV, cs.GR, cs.MM, cs.LG, cs.AI. 

The paper deals with the problem of reconstructing 3D human shape and pose from a single RGB image, which is a common problem in computer vision and graphics. The paper proposes a generative adversarial framework called PeelNet, which is motivated by ray tracing for generating realistic images of a 3D scene. This suggests that the paper is likely to belong to the computer vision (cs.CV) and graphics (cs.GR) sub-categories. Additionally, the paper mentions applications in e-commerce, health-care, and mobile-based AR/VR platforms, which suggests that it may also belong to the multimedia (cs.MM) and artificial intelligence (cs.AI) sub-categories. Finally, the paper compares its method against current state-of-the-art methods, which suggests that it may also belong to the machine learning (cs.LG) sub-category.
